name: Decline Push-Ups
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a decline push-up position on a step, bench, or incline surface with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet placed at the edge of the surface.
2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that you maintain a straight line from your head to your heels throughout the movement.

3. Keeping your body in a straight line, slowly lower yourself by bending your elbows and lowering your chest towards the ground.

4. Focus on using your pectoral muscles to push back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully and returning to the initial decline push-up stance.

5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, keeping your core engaged and movements controlled throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Decline push-ups are a variant of the traditional push-up that works the chest muscle with increased emphasis due to the incline surface, requiring more strength and control from the user.
